definition: thick weeds/luxuriant growth/Illicium anisatum, a shrub with poisonous leaves/impertinent
to knock against/to bump into/to run into/to meet by accident

sentences.english: He went about the job like a bull in a china shop.
sentences.chinese: 他干这种活就想公牛进了瓷器店那样莽撞。

sentences.english: He will not see your one side, vast bump of the hurl enter the trap of the love.
sentences.chinese: 他不会见你一面，就莽莽撞撞的投进爱情的陷阱。

sentences.english: Not obtrusive, go up pertly courtship, you can refuse for certain.
sentences.chinese: 不要莽撞，冒冒失失上去求爱，你肯定会遭拒绝。

sentences.english: What Lin Xi is him is obtrusive drive to apologize to water island.
sentences.chinese: 林夕为自己的莽撞驾驶向水岛道歉。

sentences.english: He heard it numbly, a little amazed at his audacity.
sentences.chinese: 他自己也听得一呆，对自己的莽撞劲儿有点吃惊。

sentences.english: Mr. collins he will consider it an impertinence.
She didn't invite John to her wedding because he might turn out to be a bull in a china shop .
sentences.chinese: 她没请约翰参加婚礼，因为他也许会因莽撞而生事。

sentences.english: He tumbled into the meeting room.
sentences.chinese: 他莽莽撞撞地走进了会议室。

sentences.english: Overuse will only make you look pushy.
sentences.chinese: 过度使用只会让你显得莽撞。

sentences.english: Goblin Vandal deals no combat damage this turn.
sentences.chinese: 莽撞鬼怪本回合不造成战斗伤害。

sentences.english: The reckless driver died in the traffic accident.
sentences.chinese: 那个莽撞的驾车人在这次车祸中丧生。

sentences.english: Perhaps I was too saucy and provoking .
sentences.chinese: 可能是我太莽撞无礼，咄咄逼人了。

definition: variant of 魯莽|鲁莽[lu3 mang3]
lit. not knowing what's important (idiom); no appreciation of the gravity of things/naive/doesn't know who's who/no sense of priorities
to let emotions affect one's decisions
not knowing when to come or leave (idiom); with no sense of propriety
to act rashly/to act precipitously regardless of the consequences/reckless/foolhardy/daredevil
